intro: Thesium pseudovirgatum, commonly known as the narrowleaf thesium, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Australia. It belongs to the family Xanthorrhoeaceae and is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, linear leaves. The plant produces yellowish flowers arranged in dense, spike-like clusters, which bloom during the warmer months. Thesium pseudovirgatum is typically found in sandy or rocky soils in open habitats. It is often used in native gardens for its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
